body: Can confirm. The debug build seems to be OK, only release builds are affected.
I can confirm as well. I get the same unresolved symbol on both macOS and Windows, anyone figured out the reason yet?
This might be related to https://github.com/electron/libchromiumcontent/pull/291, will investigate.
Sounds plausible since the missing symbol is in v8_libplatform according to my digging.

@kevinsawicki Yes, seem [this change](https://github.com/electron/electron/commit/a33643c51849d6026b65a5641ff6dda4ffcd55ba#diff-f2ef646527d2d648ff80506b929d11fdR30) introduced dependency on v8::platform from `electron.exe` which would cause this linker error. The hiding of v8::platform from `node.dll` was based on the assumption that it's not called from outside of that DLL. If that's not the case anymore, it can be exposed.
@alespergl okay, thanks, I'll revert the libcc change for now.

@kevinsawicki Related? OS X, Electron 1.7.1

I've seen this too but it is a separate issue. Adding -lcups in brightray/brightray.gyp for OS == mac makes the build work, but i don't know it it is the "correct" solution here.
@khwaaj Thanks.  That fixed my error, now just get the original issue error, so will pull latest.

> Related? OS X, Electron 1.7.1

Thanks so much for reporting this @TimNZ , I believe this was probably caused by #8596, we only run release builds on CI when we go to release since linking takes so long so thanks for helping us catch this earlier, fix is up at https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/9579

> Adding -lcups in brightray/brightray.gyp for OS == mac makes the build work, but i don't know it it is the "correct" solution here.

I think this is the correct solution, thanks @khwaaj  üëç
